page.title: 05Invertebrates found in Dee
page.content: Invertebrates found in the Dee ****************************** There are in the estuary itself many forms of life which provide food for larger creatures such as man. There are many{invertebrates.}There are {cockles}and{shrimps}still providing food for men.{Bogworms}and other similar{worms}are found in large numbers. Other life found in the estuary includes, the{Larver Spire {Shell,}the{Baltic Tellin}and the {Peppeny Furrow Shell.}These provide food for the many{birds}which are to be found on the estuary and salt marsh.
